suncertify.client

Class BrokerRemoteClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.client.BrokerClient
      • suncertify.client.BrokerRemoteClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, DBUpdateListener

    public class BrokerRemoteClient
extends BrokerClient
implements DBUpdateListener
    The BrokerRemoteClient is the client used when the application is running in network mode where both the client and server are running in different JVMs and may also be on different hosts. This is a subclass of the BrokerClient class and it also implements the DBUpdateListener interface.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    BrokerClient, DBUpdateListener

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerRemoteClient

        BrokerRemoteClient()
        The no-argument constructor. The constructor has package visibility to that instances cannot be created outside of the package. Creation of instances of this class can be achieved through the baseclass which also serves as a factory.
        See Also:
        BrokerClient.getClient(AppRunMode)

    • Method Detail

      • startClient

        public void startClient()
                 throws BrokerClientException
        This method executes the remote client startup process. The process involves the following steps:
        • Request client and server configuration parameters by displaying the client configuration dialog to the user.
        • Lookup of the remote server from the RMI registry.
        • Exporting itself as a remote object to enable it to receive incoming calls.
        • Registering itself with the remote server as DB update listener
        • Obtaining the RemoteClientController reference
        • Creating the client GUI
        Overrides:
        startClient in class BrokerClient
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - if an error is encountered during the startup process
        See Also:
        RemoteClientController, BrokerRMIServer.startServer(), BrokerAppClientGUI

      • stopClient

        public void stopClient()
                throws BrokerClientException
        This method executes the remote client termination process if the client startup was previously done successfully. The shutdown process includes the following steps:
        • Unregistering the client for DB updates from the remote DB BrokerServer.
        • Unexporting the client so it is removed from the RMI runtime.
        • Stopping the RemoteClientController
        Specified by:
        stopClient in class BrokerClient
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - if an error is encountered during the shutdown process
        See Also:
        RemoteClientController.stopController(), BrokerServer.unregisterUpdateListener(int), UnicastRemoteObject.unexportObject(Remote,boolean)
